Posts.Content: iwannabefree50 wrote: I have had the breast MRI, so I know what that is like. I have also have had stereotactic core biopsy on my other breast so I understand that. Is this basically just combining the two procedures? I am assuming this will hurt some and be distressing to me. Can someone walk me through what will most likely happen? (from the patient's perspective) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What is an MRI guided biopsy like? iwannabefree50 pennsygal

Posts.Content: iwannabefree50 wrote: Does anyone know this? Have they done a study? I am worried. It seems like stirring up trouble to be poking around in cancerous cells and might possibly be setting them loose to be spread. I know I am worrying. I had cancer once. Had a mastectomy. Now I just had a couple biopsies in the other breast and It is so bloody and painful. I am so tired. I know I am imagining cancer being spread into my bloodstream and lymph vessels. Can that happen? It's ok. Tell me I am crazy! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Can the core biopsy spread cancer? iwannabefree50 Hopeful82014
